message.content:
cs.IT, cs.SI, cs.NI, cs.DS, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the problem of recovering sparse signals from underdetermined linear measurements, which is a common topic in information theory (cs.IT) and signal processing (cs.SI). The use of a graph to characterize topological constraints is a key aspect of the paper, which suggests that it may also be relevant to networked systems (cs.NI) and graph theory (cs.DS). Finally, the paper proposes explicit measurement constructions and derives bounds on the minimum number of measurements needed, which are topics that are often studied in machine learning (cs.LG).
